body: Thanks for posting, Omid, and you are on the right track but, by default the WH2BTU component just converts the energy units (kilowatts to kilo-BTUs). Not the flux (Energy per unit area).  So you just need one more step in order to convert the values to kBTU/ft2.  Also, I might recommend using the recolor mesh so that you can more easily set the legend bounds bu the create legend component is a fine solution as well. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/OKuVBbfwBdF3KMEF-kOv7UUQwZmHhZUrzDpxdBc8b333og3ORDXWLE*N*lexM*9Et9uaXLu8xgW95QBosgv3r-9u8f01vmkj/kBTUperFT2.JPG) I should also note that the WH2BTU component is smart enough to convert EUI (also energy per unit area) for energy model results as long as there's a Ladybug header on the data.  But, by default, it's only doing an energy unit conversion.
